intro: Siphocampylus actinothrix f. minor, commonly known as the dwarf sun-cup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
